intro: Terebinthina camphorata, commonly known as the camphor tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and bark that contain camphor. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth margin, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. The fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed.
